channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Many Lime bikes scattered in road, 30th August
item.description:
Once again many Lime bike are obstructing the road and pavement, this time many are tipped over. There are always far too many bikes for the area in this location. It’s dangerous, obstructive and invites noise pollution for local residents due to the amount of people in one place.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-13, Triangle Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Defective Street Light, 30th August
item.description:
Opposite Nando’s restaurant, 16-17 Market Place, Bexleyheath: Please fix a defective street light which is not turning on at night - picture attached.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Market Place, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering to lamposts in area., 30th August
item.description:
20+flags appeared fixed to lampposts etc by a group of men with a pick up truck . I assume they are not officially in place due to the adhoc nature of placement, they are flying at half mast and many are upside down!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lance Corporal Nicky Mason Way
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin outside Cator Park, 30th August
item.description:
I reported the overflowing bin outside Cator Park about a week ago . Yesterday I got an email telling me the problem has been fixed . The problem hasn’t been fixed and one week later the bin is still overflowing . Very poor .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aldersmead Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes all over the road, 30th August
item.description:
Road surface completely destroyed, potholes, the road post a threat to the public and to the cars, no pavement for pedestrians, cars avoiding potholes can easily hit the passing people, on the top of it street is used as parking lot for vehicles during the week, my proposal would be to resurface the road, and if you do you can charge people for parking on it, this should pay off the repairs
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carlton Place, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collapsing Road, 30th August
item.description:
The road in this part of Woodhurst Avenue is collapsing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodhurst Avenue, Petts Wood, London

item.title: Entrance to Granville Rec, 30th August
item.description:
A temporary shelter has been set up and people are living and cooking on open fire on site. There is loads of rubbish including furniture such as hobs, mattresses, wardrobes etc..
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Granville Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
